availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Biffle (Maury County, Tennessee, farmer)

body.p: Maury County, Tennessee, farmer. North Carolina native. Son of Jacob Biffle and Mary Biffle. Married Francis Isom Biffle in Maury County, Tennessee, on June 19, 1829. Father of Mary A. Biffle, Adley B. Biffle, William M. Biffle, Alice P. Biffle, Jacob D. Biffle, James K. W. Biffle, Francis A. Biffle, and U. S. Biffle. Resident in Maury County in 1830. Owned two enslaved persons in Maury County in 1830. Farmer in Lewis County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Lewis County in 1850. Farmer in Maury County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons (including one man named Friday) in Maury County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Wayne County in 1860. Employed one enslaved person owned by the heirs of S. C. Mitchell in Wayne County in 1860.
